blogPost.title: Rich countries have ordered more vaccines than they need. Poorer ones face dire shortages https://t.co/b3qyjErake
blogPost.author: The Economist

localize.full_text: 富国订购的疫苗超过了它们的需要。较穷的国家面临严重的短缺https://t.co/b3qyjErake
富國訂購的疫苗超過了它們的需要。較窮的國家面臨嚴重的短缺https://t.co/b3qyjErake

previous.title: Have women been better leaders during the pandemic? “There are so fewer [women]...in charge of those issues, the fact that many of them have been successful is also an indication that they’re pretty damn good,” says @Lagarde on “The Economist Asks” podcast https://t.co/3g3rbXs7LK https://t.co/Zl1DUfWVdx

localize.full_text: 女性在大流行期间是否有更好的领导力？"[女性]......负责这些问题的人太少了，事实上，她们中的很多人都获得了成功，这也说明她们非常该死的优秀。"@拉加德在 "经济学家问 "播客https://t.co/3g3rbXs7LK https://t.co/Zl1DUfWVdx。
女性在大流行期間是否有更好的領導力？"[女性]......負責這些問題的人太少了，事實上，她們中的很多人都獲得了成功，這也說明她們非常該死的優秀。"@拉加德在 "經濟學家問 "播客https://t.co/3g3rbXs7LK https://t.co/Zl1DUfWVdx。

next.title: A recent study found that in-person schooling accelerated the spread of the virus only in places where prevailing infection rates were relatively high https://t.co/ca1SDUL195

localize.full_text: 最近的一项研究发现，只有在普遍感染率相对较高的地方，面对面的学校教育才会加速病毒的传播https://t.co/ca1SDUL195。
最近的一項研究發現，只有在普遍感染率相對較高的地方，面對面的學校教育才會加速病毒的傳播https://t.co/ca1SDUL195。
